title: Neighborhoods: Exploring Wilmington
name: Neighborhoods: Exploring Wilmington
description:
A Map by Waltdowdy

This map is all about learning about neighborhoods and real estate in Wilmington NC. In addition to information and pictures on neighborhoods, I will also be posting pictures on important local attractions. If you live outside of Wilmington (as markers are added), you will be able to explore Wilmington with this map. Subscribe to the feed to stay up-to-date on Walt Dowdy's platial map.
To learn more about Walt Dowdy, visit http://wilmingtonncrealestate.wordpress.com or www.waltdowdy.com
Walt Dowdy
Keller Williams Realty
www.waltdowdy.com
Wilmington, NC

properties.name: Airlie Forest
properties.description: Posted by Waltdowdy  Airlie Forest is a small neighborhood of upscale luxury homes, built by some of Wilmington’s top custom builders. How many homes does the community have? 8 Homes Builders: Hagood Homes; Bluewater Development; Derose Builders; WK Trask Construction Price Range: Upper 00s to Upper 00s Style of Homes: Low Country, Cottage, Georgian, Traditional Square Footage Range: 2600-4100 Age of Homes: 2002-2008 Amenities: Gate on the Wrightsville Avenue side to prevent through traffic. Pros: Airlie Gardens is right across the road. Shopping at Mayfaire, Lumina Station, Landfall Center, the Forum are all very very close. Wrightsville Beach is just a 3 to 4 minute drive away. Cons: This neighborhood may be a little small for some people. Sales Activity: 1 Sale in 2007 in the mid 00 range.

properties.name: Forest Hills
properties.description: Posted by Waltdowdy Search Wilmington properties online now. Community Description Forest Hills is often referred to loosely as the area that makes up several neighborhoods located in and around the Cape Fear Country Club. The actual Forest Hills subdivision, however, is only the area between Market St. and Wrightsville Ave. The homes in Forest Hills are a joy to see if you are a fan of the character of older homes. The architectural styles are diverse. Mature Live Oaks with spanish moss line many of the streets, giving a picturesque southern feel to the area that makes you want to stop your car and take a leisurely stroll. Another plus is the neighborhood elementary school, Forest Hills Elementary, which is a global school that just recently received a major facelift. You can expect to mostly find homes built from the 1920\'s to 1950\'s, but building has continued up to date with custom homes built within the last decade. Price Range 00s to m+ Square Footage Range 1800 - 5000+ Age of Homes early 1900s to 2007 Need More Information? Click Here to request more information on this neighborhood. Search Wilmington properties online now.

properties.name: Gray Gables
properties.description: Posted by Waltdowdy Walt Dowdy

properties.name: Highland Hills & Glen Meade
properties.description: Posted by Waltdowdy Search Wilmington properties online now. Community Description Highland Hills and Glen Meade are communities that neighbor Forest Hills. Highland Hills covers that area from the Cape Fear Country Club to right up behind New Hanover Regional Medical Center. Glen Meade is positioned between Independence Drive and Highland Hills. Price range for the Highland Hills neighborhood is 00 up to over million. You can find homes ranging as small as 2000 sqft. up to over 6000 sqft. Highland Hills homes are not as old as those you can find in Forest Hills. Construction began in Highland Hills in the 1950\'s and has continued up till recent times. In Glen Meade, you are going to find homes ranging in price from the upper 00s to million. Square footage range is 2000-5000 sqft. Age range you are looking at is going to be from around the 1970\'s to 2000\'s. Both Highland Hills and Glen Meade are beautiful neighborhoods that flow seamlessly into one another. It is difficult to tell them apart when you are driving through. They open up to major four-lane highways (Oleander and Independence) that can basically take you any where you need to go in Wilmington NC, but once you are inside the neighborhoods it is easy to forget that busy, high-paced life going on all around you. It truly is an enchanting escape. Price Range 00s to m+ Square Footage Range 2000 to 6000+ Age of Homes early 1970s to 2000s Need More Information? Click Here to request more information on this neighborhood. Search Wilmington properties online now.

properties.name: Monkey Junction
properties.description: Posted by Waltdowdy A major intersection where the primary commercial shopping area for the southern portion of Wilmington is located. The name Monkey Junction comes a story of a convenient store (a long time ago) where the owner wanted to generate more business from people who got on off the bus at the intersection. He bought a monkey and chained the monkey outside the convinient store to attract customers. The name Monkey Junction stuck. Further community description coming soon!

properties.name: Summer Rest
properties.description: Posted by Waltdowdy Community Description: As you turn onto Summer Rest Rd., just shy of crossing the Wrightsville Beach bridge, you immediately shift gears and slow down. Though the speed limit is 9mph, I am not referring to your car. Summer Rest, in my opinion, is one of the very best locations in all of Wilmington. The name Summer Rest says it all. The gear shifting I am referring to is attitude. When you drive down Summer Rest, better yet, live in Summer Rest, you are reminded of why Wilmington NC is such a great place to live. Life slows down in Summer Rest. Homes in Summer Rest are nestled naturally underneath mature live oak trees with picturesque Spanish moss hanging from the limbs, gently swaying to the coastal breeze of the intracoastal waterway. Homes located on Summer Rest Rd. boast incomparable intracoastal views. Most of these homes have boat slips, giving easy access to a lazy day on the blue Atlantic waterways that embrace Wilmington\'s mainland. Homes off of Summer Rest Rd. enjoy the tranquility of quiet enjoyment underneath the mature trees and lush landscaping. At the end of Summer Rest Rd. is Summer Rest trail, a paved nature trail that meanders along one of Landfall’s walls. A nature’s retreat, Summer Rest trail leads to the business park where the Port City Chop House is located. Speaking of restaurants, some of Wilmington’s finest restaurants are in walking distance from Summer Rest: Boca Bay, The Bridgetender, and Airlie Grille. The Dockside as well as the fine restaurants at Lumina Station are a very short drive away. Not to mention, Wrightsville Beach and the loop are a short bike ride away. How many homes does this community have? 50 - 60 Homes (Only 14 Waterfront Homes) Price Range: Upper 00s to m+ Style of Homes: Low Country, Cottage, Traditional, Transitional (all custom built with a variety of architectural styles) Square Footage Range: 1500 to 6000+ Age of Homes: Early 1900s to 2004 Pros: Breathtaking views of the intracoastal waterways, boatslips for homes on Summer Rest Rd., Quiet neighborhood, convinient to Wrightsville Beach and nearby shopping. Cons: Can’t think of any. Sales Activity: None. Homes are rarely for sale in Summer Rest. For More Information: Contact Walt Dowdy today for a free list of homes currently available in Summer Rest. Simply fill out this form and type in the comments box “List of Current Available Homes in Summer Rest”. You will receive the list of homes via email with no-obligation. You may also want to: Search Wilmington properties online now. Learn more about Wilmington NC at WaltDowdy.com and Wilmington NC :: Real Estate Blog.

properties.name: Sunset Park
properties.description: Posted by Waltdowdy Search Wilmington properties online now. Community Description Sunset Park is one of Wilmington\'s older neighborhoods located near the port on the Cape Fear River. Many of the homes in Sunset Park are quaint bungalows and cottages. With the latest craze in renovating homes, many of these historic homes in Sunset Park have been brought back to life putting Sunset Park on the map as an up and coming area for Wilmington NC. Price Range Low 00s to Mid 00s Community Size: Over 150 homes Architecture Styles Mostly Bungalow and Cottage, and some Ranch and Traditional styles Square Footage Range 700s - 2600s Age of Homes 1907 - 2007 2007 Sales Statistics Homes Sold: 41 Average Days on Market: 69 Average Sales Price: 58,923 For More Information: Contact Walt Dowdy today for a free list of homes currently available in Sunset Park. Simply fill out this form and type in the comments box "List of Current Available Homes in Sunset Park". You will receive the list of homes via email with no-obligation. properties.name: Tangle Oaks
properties.description: Posted by Waltdowdy A small tucked away community with waterfront access along with a community marina. Homes are nestled under mature live oaks draped with spanish moss that sway in the wind. A friendly community with architecturally diverse custom built homes. At the waterfront end of the community are townhomes that overlook the marina and intracoastal waterway. Further community description coming soon!

properties.name: Woodscape - Waterfront Community
properties.description: Posted by Waltdowdy This is a small community of Custom Built Homes with a community trail that leads to a small beach on the intracoastal. The swimming area over looks the Masonboro Island with a swing and a gazebo. Community residents all own golf carts and make their way down to the water in this tucked away part of waterfront Wilmington. Further community description coming soon!
